episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics, including the history of Venice's Rialto Bridge, a scientific experiment in Italy searching for rare particle events, the opium trade connections of Siegfried Sassoon's family, and the elusive Murray's plums in Texas.

facts.fact: Venice's most famous bridge was built by a man named Antonio the Bridge.
For the last seven years, a science lab in Italy has continuously been looking for something that supposedly happens less than once every trillion trillion years.
Siegfried Sassoon's great grandfather once owned half the opium in India and China.
No living person has ever seen Murray's plums.
